technique: Bloom swirl 70g water for 8 seconds, pour (low and fast) 200g by 1:00, finish by 1:20. Do a 2–3 second Rao Spin ASAP.

acidity.notes: Juicy, full, slight dark purple tang throughout like the skin of a plum. Decreases slightly as cools.

sweetness.notes: Smooth, rich, creamy. Fairly complex, but I almost want more. Still soft and sweet as cools.

body.notes: Light syrup? Creaminess could be from the sweetness.

finish.notes: Not really a finish, or rather the taste just 'washes out'. Relatively neutral mouthfeel at least.

flavor: First impressions: juicy. Full and mouthwatering acidity like a sweet peach, dark tang like the skin of a plum. Creamy, very sweet. Very close — if this were just slightly more complex and had a nice long finish, I'd give this a 10.
observations: Drawdown was initially fast so I did the Rao Spin as soon as possible.
actionItem: Goal is to shorten brew time by 5-10 seconds. Finish pour markers by 0:57/0:17.
